content: His administration is telling Iran that they do not have to stop their nuclear activities before they come to the negotiating table. I simply do not trust the Iranians, I'm not somebody who believes they would use nuclear weapons, but it would change the entire dynamic in the region and change it for the worst as far as America is concerned. I also find it hard, incredibly hard to believe that Israel would not attack Iran if they received concrete intelligence that Iran has reached the point of no return...regardless of whether America approves or not. Better to stir the hornets nest and **** off your neighbor and friend than let them get a nuclear capability. Israel will act, this is a situation where talking is just not the answer. It's not going to work, what planet do some people live on? after 30 years of America telling them to "STFU" their suddenly going to embrace us?
reply: His administration is telling Iran that they do not have to stop their nuclear activities before they come to the negotiating table. I simply do not trust the Iranians, I'm not somebody who believes they would use nuclear weapons, but it would change the entire dynamic in the region and change it for the worst as far as America is concerned. I also find it hard, incredibly hard to believe that Israel would not attack Iran if they received concrete intelligence that Iran has reached the point of no return...regardless of whether America approves or not. content: Wonder if Isreal will blow the reactor to hell like they did in the '80's? If so, is 0bama gonna declare war on Isreal?
reply: Wonder if Isreal will blow the reactor to hell like they did in the '80's? If so, is 0bama gonna declare war on Isreal?
title: President Obama's first big mistake....

content: I don't think Israel will do it again. The political environment is much different than it was in the '80s, and they still haven't recovered internationally from their recent incursion into Gaza. Such a move would put the US under tremendous pressure internationally, particularly if we are now seen as making friendly gestures toward the Persians. It would be very difficult for the US to support them if the UN Security Council called for condemnation. We couldn't even get away with abstaining if Israel committed essentially an act of war against a sovereign entity. I call it an "act of war" because there's no proof that Iran's nuclear program is producing weapons, so their program cannot (from what we know) be called a hostile act.
reply: I don't think Israel will do it again. Such a move would put the US under tremendous pressure internationally, particularly if we are now seen as making friendly gestures toward the Persians. content: President Obama's first big mistake.... ...was going allong with President Bush and his bailouts. But Obama took them to another level. And then there was the bloated stimulas bill. Follow up that with a 3.6 trillion dollar budget. Cabinet appointees who seem to believe that they need not pay taxes. Then there is the left wing radical, Rosa Brooks Obama assigned to the Pentagon. Can you say security risk? How many "big mistakes" are we up to so far? And then North Korea launches a long range missile and the president cant't get a UN resolution condemning this. First big mistake? Don't think so.

content: quote: Originally posted by navy8086: Wonder if Isreal will blow the reactor to hell like they did in the '80's? If so, is 0bama gonna declare war on Isreal? He won't declare war on Israel - but it will likely be the first time that the US has not abstained from voting when the UN Security Council holds the vote to condemn Isreal's actions - and will likely vote along with everybody else on the council for condemnation and sanctions. He might well also freeze weapons shipments to Israel. The odds of Israel striking Iran are slim at this point though - they would have to go through Iraqi airspace to do it - and the USAF OWNS that airspace.
quote: Originally posted by navy8086: Wonder if Isreal will blow the reactor to hell like they did in the '80's? If so, is 0bama gonna declare war on Isreal?

The odds of Israel striking Iran are slim at this point though - they would have to go through Iraqi airspace to do it - and the USAF OWNS that airspace.
title: President Obama's first big mistake....
